instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus - 12.28V
threads.message:
This board will not power.
PPBUS - 12.28V
<SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> - 0V
Green light present
SCL and SDA at battery connector at 3.48V

I replaced <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> and later SMC with same one from same board and I have still PPBUS - 12.28V

Anything more I can check?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus - 12.28V
threads.message: Seems a bad soldering job on ISL or still a bad SMC........  Also remove BIL if it is still on...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus - 12.28V
threads.message: It should power on with PPBUS at 12.3V anyway. SMC issue is suspected. What is diode mode on both data pins on the battery connector?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus - 12.28V
threads.message:
Bettery connector

pin4 - 1.899 and 0.559
pin6 - .0L and 0.556

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus - 12.28V
threads.message: Those values are close enough. What is the history on this board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus - 12.28V
threads.message: Customer told me liquide damage 2 month ago and somebody repaired lvds connector. It works 2 months and 1 week ago didnot power anymore.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus - 12.28V
threads.message:
Well, I forgot to tell that before replacing the SMC first time I had 1V at pin 4 and 3.48V at pin 6 
After SMC was reflowed and later replaced I had 3.48V in both 4 and 6 pins (battery connector) scl and sda.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus - 12.28V
